resources.string: Please set your current position and continue your actions.
Customer ID can not be empty
Developer ID can not be empty
Session is probably expired. Please resign in an application.

Please check internet connection settings. 
 Take the following troubleshooting steps to ensure network connectivity: 
 
 Step 1. Go to Settings > More. Check on the "Airplane mode," wait 5 seconds, and remove check 
 
 Step 2. Go to Settings > More > Mobile networks. Ensure that "Data enabled" is checked "on." If it is already "on," then remove check, wait 5 seconds, and check back "on" 
 
 Step 3. Confirm that your phone is in a data reception zone. Check the upper right to confirm that there are reception bars and (preferably) a 4G icon. If there are no bars, move to a place with bars. You can confirm whether your connection is working by going to the browser and navigating to a site 
 
 Step 4. If none of the above work, take the phone off of 4G. Go to Settings > More > Mobile networks > Network Mode. Check "CDMA" option (rather than "LTE/CDMA")

Please take the following troubleshooting steps: 
 
 Step 1. Go to Settings and ensure that Wi-Fi is set to "on." If it is already set to "on," toggle to "off" and then turn back to "on" after 5 seconds 
 
 Step 2. If Step 1 did not solve the problem, then the phone is seeking to attach to an open Wi-Fi network that requires authentication. You must manually detach the phone from all Wi-Fi networks: 
 
 - Go to Settings and tap on Wi-Fi 
 
 - You will see a list of networks. Tap each network that does not have a "lock" icon next to it, then tap a second time to get a dialog box that will display an option to "forget." Touch the "forget" option. (You may need to scroll to find the network and tap it a second time to get the "forget" pop-up)

Something went wrong 
 
 Take the following troubleshooting steps to ensure network connectivity: 
 
 Step 1. Go to Settings > More. Check on the "Airplane mode," wait 5 seconds, and remove check 
 
 Step 2. Go to Settings > More > Mobile networks. Ensure that "Data enabled" is checked "on." If it is already "on," then remove check, wait 5 seconds, and check back "on" 
 
 Step 3. Confirm that your phone is in a data reception zone. Check the upper right to confirm that there are reception bars and (preferably) a 4G icon. If there are no bars, move to a place with bars. You can confirm whether your connection is working by going to the browser and navigating to a site 
 
 Step 4. If none of the above work, take the phone off of 4G. Go to Settings > More > Mobile networks > Network Mode. Check "CDMA" option (rather than "LTE/CDMA")

Oops. Server returned error. 
 
 Take the following troubleshooting steps to ensure network connectivity: 
 
 Step 1. Go to Settings > More. Check on the "Airplane mode," wait 5 seconds, and remove check 
 
 Step 2. Go to Settings > More > Mobile networks. Ensure that "Data enabled" is checked "on." If it is already "on," then remove check, wait 5 seconds, and check back "on" 
 
 Step 3. Confirm that your phone is in a data reception zone. Check the upper right to confirm that there are reception bars and (preferably) a 4G icon. If there are no bars, move to a place with bars. You can confirm whether your connection is working by going to the browser and navigating to a site 
 
 Step 4. If none of the above work, take the phone off of 4G. Go to Settings > More > Mobile networks > Network Mode. Check "CDMA" option (rather than "LTE/CDMA")
Please set your location on the map.
This program requires SD Card. Please insert it and try again.
We found scanning logs on SD Card. Would you like to delete them?
Mobile Internet Connection was detected. Would you like to turn off mobile internet?
Would you like to turn Mobile Internet Connection on?
